      • isAutoSaveIfInactive

        public boolean isAutoSaveIfInactive()
        Returns:
        true if IDE saves all files after "idle" timeout.

      • setAutoSaveIfInactive

        public void setAutoSaveIfInactive(boolean autoSaveIfInactive)

      • getInactiveTimeout

        public int getInactiveTimeout()
        Returns:
        timeout in seconds after which IDE saves all files if there was no user activity. The method always return positive (more then zero) value.

      • setInactiveTimeout

        public void setInactiveTimeout(int inactiveTimeoutSeconds)

      • getState

        public GeneralSettings getState()
        Specified by:
        getState in interface PersistentStateComponent<GeneralSettings>
        Returns:
        a component state. All properties, public and annotated fields are serialized. Only values, which differ from the default (i.e., the value of newly instantiated class) are serialized. null value indicates that the returned state won't be stored, as a result previously stored state will be used.
        See Also:
        XmlSerializer

      • loadState

        public void loadState(GeneralSettings state)
        Description copied from interface: PersistentStateComponent
        This method is called when new component state is loaded. The method can and will be called several times, if config files were externally changed while IDE was running.

        State object should be used directly, defensive copying is not required.

        Specified by:
        loadState in interface PersistentStateComponent<GeneralSettings>
        Parameters:
        state - loaded component state
        See Also:
        XmlSerializerUtil.copyBean(Object, Object)

      • getConfirmOpenNewProject

        public int getConfirmOpenNewProject()
        Returns:
        • OPEN_PROJECT_NEW_WINDOW if new project should be opened in new window
        • OPEN_PROJECT_SAME_WINDOW if new project should be opened in same window
        • OPEN_PROJECT_ASK if a confirmation dialog should be shown
